intro: Nepeta longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract catmint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is often used in herbal teas and aromatherapy due to its calming properties. Nepeta longibracteata is also valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
